title: Suspect arrested in fatal Grove City shooting
content:
Hide caption Michael John Kassner
Police arrested a suspect in a fatal Grove City shooting just before noon Wednesday at a motorcycle clubhouse.
Police arrested a suspect in a fatal Grove City shooting just before noon Wednesday at a motorcycle clubhouse.
Michael Kassner, 29, is accused of firing a gun Tuesday afternoon inside the Lost Souls clubhouse. The bullet apparently went through the wall and struck Bruce Stevens, 59, of Grove City, who was sitting in the driver's seat of a car parked outside a gym near Parkmead Drive and Garden Court at about 4 p.m., according to Grove City Police.
Stevens was found shot in the head and pronounced dead at the scene about an hour later.
"We don't believe he was being targeted," said Grove City Police Lt. Brian Davidson, who called Stevens a "completely innocent victim."
Police were called to the scene at about 5 p.m. Tuesday by the manager of nearby Power Shack Family Fitness gym at 4048 Parkmead Dr., who noticed Stevens' car had a shattered window, according to a 911 call. The man looked inside and saw Stevens, bloody and unconscious. The car was still running.
Kassner, whose address was not given by police, is charged with reckless homicide.
